review: I had it for a month as Amazon gave me a 30-day trial. I am really satisfied, however I had to return it because $99 is a little more than what I could afford. The voice search function was exceptional, did not have a problem recognizing what I was trying to say. The box and remote were both really pretty, and the texture was awesome. I would recommend people who don't think $99 is too expensive to give it a try. Oh, and I didn't try the gaming part, since I have a PS3 already.
author: Kevin Chang

review: Amazing little box. I demo'd this for free and knew on the second night of using this that I wouldn't return it. The processor speed makes browsing very pleasant, and after installing XBMC to play media from network devices, this is the answer to everything I would want.
author: R. Sutherland

review: Just switched from Roku and Samsung's built in streamer to Amazon fire. Picture quality and color fidelity is amazing. Easy to navigate and voice recognition works great.

author: Gail Drouin

review: Love it so far, love amazon overall as a company. So I'm happy they delivered a solid product. My only complaint is that when using this to access hulu+ it still doesn't allow all content. Some programs are listed as "online only" which is annoying but I guess it has to do with some licensing issue with televising content. Oh well, after owning it a month I've turned in my cable box for good. I also own quite a few movies thru amazon so it's nice to have access, as well as a surprising amount of movies/tv shows that are accessible free with a prime membership.
